summary: The Fire Information and Reaction Enhancement Act of 2025 (FIRE Act of 2025) directs the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to establish a program to improve wildfire forecasting and detection. The program aims to reduce loss of life, injury, and property damage by improving predictions of wildfire spread, smoke dispersion, information dissemination, and early detection. It authorizes activities including advanced satellite detection, grid-based assessments, fire modeling, and improved observations. The bill also mandates the creation of weather research testbeds and authorizes $15 million in appropriations for fiscal year 2026.
